title: Sex And The City star Kristin Davis looks radiant as she cuddles up to Rob Lowe
text:
Kristin Davis cuddled up to Rob Lowe on Tuesday evening at the screening of Netflix's upcoming Christmas movie, Holiday In The Wild, in which they both star.

Sex And The City star Kristin, 54, looked radiant as she joined her leading man, 55, at The London Hotel in West Hollywood.

She kept things chic in a black ensemble: a blouse with a square neckline and elaborate cuffs, with matching tailored slacks.

Cosy co-stars: Kristin Davis cuddled up to Rob Lowe on Tuesday evening at the screening of Netflix's upcoming Christmas movie, Holiday In The Wild, in which they both star

She wore her chestnut mane loosely tumbling around her shoulders and showcased her natural beauty with a minimal wash of foundation, her cheeks rouged and her lips slicked with a dab of rose.

Rob - who has been married to his wife Sheryl Berkoff since 1991 - went casual in jeans, a black top and a leather jacket over the top.

The couple filmed the movie in Africa last summer and star alongside John Owen Lowe - Rob's real-life son.

The story is set against the backdrop of the elephant poaching and conservation battles in the African wilderness and focuses on Kristin's character who goes on safari after her husband leaves her.

Smart: She kept things chic in a black ensemble as she posed for snaps

Chic: She wore a blouse with a square neckline and elaborate cuffs

All in the family: Kristin and Rob posed with John Owen Lowe - Rob's real-life son, who also appears in the film

She arrives in Africa with her son [John Owen] and meets bush pilot and elephant conservationist Rob.

It's taken a few years for the project to be green-lit, and stems from Kristin's personal love for elephants.

She has been an advocate for the animals since 2009, dedicating her platform to raising awareness around illegal poaching for ivory.

In 2015 Davis executive produced the documentary Gardeners Of Eden, also distributed by Netflix, which looked at the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust, who work on this cause.
